title: Data Protection Impact Assessment - Community Moderation System

processingOperations.name: Content Moderation and Reporting
processingOperations.description: Processing of user-generated content reports, moderation decisions, and enforcement actions
purposes: Platform safety and harmful content prevention
dataCategories: Content reports (reporter identity, reported content snapshot, explanation, evidence)
Moderation decisions (moderator ID, decision reasoning, policy violations, actions taken)
Audit trails (timestamps, IP addresses, user agents, action metadata)
Statement of Reasons (facts, legal/ToS grounds, automation usage, redress options)

automatedDecisionMaking.description: Automated content classification and priority scoring for moderation queue
automatedDecisionMaking.userRights: Users can contest automated classifications through appeals process

necessity.assessment: Necessary to comply with DSA obligations and maintain platform safety
necessity.alternatives: No viable alternative to systematic content moderation for DSA compliance
necessity.proportionality: Data collection limited to minimum necessary for moderation decisions and legal defense

measures: Content snapshots stored with hash verification, not full content duplication
Reporter contact collected only when required by Art. 16 (with documented exceptions)
Moderator IDs pseudonymized in public transparency reports
PII scrubbed from SoR submissions to Commission Transparency Database
Device fingerprinting avoided unless explicit consent obtained (ePrivacy compliance)
dataMinimization.retentionPeriod: 12 months for active reports; 30 days for PII in decisions; 7 years for anonymized audit trails
dataMinimization.deletionProcedure: Automated deletion workflow with legal hold exception handling

rightsImpact.rightToAccess: Users can request access to their reports, moderation decisions, and appeals via data export
rightsImpact.rightToErasure: Limited by legal obligation (DSA audit requirements) and legitimate interests (fraud prevention); honored after retention period or if lawful basis ceases
rightsImpact.rightToRectification: Users can update contact information; cannot modify immutable audit trails
rightsImpact.rightToPortability: Structured JSON export available for user-generated reports and appeals
rightsImpact.rightToObject: Users can object to automated profiling; cannot object to legal obligation processing (DSA compliance)
rightsImpact.rightToRestriction: Processing restriction available during appeals; not applicable to legal obligation processing

securityMeasures: Encryption at rest (AES-256) for all moderation data
Encryption in transit (TLS 1.3) for all API communications
Role-based access control with principle of least privilege
Cryptographic signatures for audit trail integrity
Append-only (WORM) storage for audit events with tamper detection
Regular security audits and penetration testing
Incident response plan with breach notification procedures

risks.type: Unauthorized access to sensitive moderation data
risks.mitigation: Multi-factor authentication, role-based access control, comprehensive access logging

risks.type: Moderator bias or discrimination in decisions
risks.mitigation: Policy catalog with objective criteria, conflict-of-interest prevention, appeals process with different reviewers
Encryption, access controls, pseudonymization in transparency reports, incident response plan

risks.type: Excessive data retention violating storage limitation
risks.mitigation: Automated deletion workflows, documented retention schedules, quarterly retention audits

processingOperations.name: Age Verification and Minor Protection
processingOperations.description: Privacy-preserving age verification to enforce age-gating for restricted content per DSA Art. 28
purposes: Prevent minors from accessing age-restricted content
Implement safer defaults for minor accounts
dataCategories: Age attribute (over-18 boolean, no raw birthdate)
One-time verification token (session-based, no persistent ID storage)
Verification attempt metadata (timestamp, IP address for fraud prevention)
dataSubjects: Minors attempting to access age-restricted content

automatedDecisionMaking.description: Automated age-gating enforcement based on verification status
automatedDecisionMaking.userRights: Users can appeal age verification failures and provide alternative verification methods

necessity.assessment: Necessary to comply with DSA Art. 28 and protect minors from inappropriate content
necessity.alternatives: Privacy-preserving age attribute verification (EU Age-Verification Blueprint) preferred over ID document storage
necessity.proportionality: Minimal data collection (boolean attribute only), no persistent ID storage, no profiling of minors

measures: Store only over-18 boolean attribute, not raw birthdate or ID documents
One-time verification with reusable age token (no repeated ID checks)
No device fingerprinting without explicit ePrivacy consent
Safer defaults for unverified users (restrict access, no profiling ads)
dataMinimization.retentionPeriod: Session-based tokens (expire on logout); age attribute valid until user disputes
dataMinimization.deletionProcedure: Tokens deleted on session termination; age attribute deleted on account deletion

rightsImpact.rightToAccess: Users can request verification status and timestamp
rightsImpact.rightToErasure: Age attribute deleted on account deletion; cannot delete during active session without re-verification
rightsImpact.rightToRectification: Users can request re-verification if age attribute incorrect
rightsImpact.rightToPortability: Minimal data (boolean attribute) included in data export
rightsImpact.rightToObject: Users cannot object to legal obligation processing (DSA compliance)
rightsImpact.rightToRestriction: Not applicable to legal obligation processing

securityMeasures: Encryption at rest for age attributes
No persistent storage of raw ID documents
Regular audits of verification provider compliance

risks.type: Circumvention of age verification by minors
risks.mitigation: Fallback verification on suspicious signals, periodic re-verification, user education

risks.type: Data breach exposing age verification data
risks.mitigation: No persistent ID storage, encryption, minimal data collection (boolean attribute only)

risks.type: Discrimination against users without verification documents
risks.mitigation: Multiple verification methods, alternative verification paths, appeal process

processingOperations.name: Geo-Location and Regional Content Restrictions
processingOperations.description: Geographic content filtering to comply with regional laws and cultural sensitivities
purposes: Cultural sensitivity and localized content controls
dataCategories: IP address (for geolocation, retained only for session)
GPS coordinates (only with explicit consent, for enhanced accuracy)

automatedDecisionMaking.description: Automated geo-blocking based on detected user location
automatedDecisionMaking.userRights: Users can appeal geo-blocking decisions and request manual review

necessity.assessment: Necessary to comply with regional laws and prevent distribution of illegal content in restricted jurisdictions
necessity.alternatives: IP geolocation as default (no consent required per ePrivacy); GPS only with explicit consent
necessity.proportionality: Minimal data collection (IP address for session only), no persistent location tracking

measures: Default to IP geolocation (server-side, no persistent storage)
GPS location requested only with explicit consent and clear user benefit
No device fingerprinting without ePrivacy-compliant consent
Cached location decisions with 1-hour TTL, re-check on app start
Apply most restrictive setting when signals mismatch (IP vs GPS)
dataMinimization.retentionPeriod: IP addresses not persistently stored; cached location decisions 1 hour TTL
dataMinimization.deletionProcedure: Automatic cache expiry, no long-term location storage

rightsImpact.rightToAccess: Users can request current detected location and geo-blocking status
rightsImpact.rightToErasure: Minimal persistent data (cached decisions expire automatically)
rightsImpact.rightToRectification: Users can dispute location detection via appeal process
rightsImpact.rightToObject: Users can object to GPS tracking; cannot object to IP geolocation (legal obligation)
rightsImpact.rightToRestriction: Not applicable to legal obligation processing

securityMeasures: No persistent storage of raw GPS coordinates
IP addresses used only for session-based geolocation
Access controls for geo-blocking rule configuration

risks.mitigation: VPN detection with configurable blocking, appeal process for false positives
Appeal flow with manual review, transparent 'why can't I see this?' explainers
No persistent location storage, GPS only with explicit consent, no device fingerprinting

technicalMeasures: Implement encryption at rest and in transit for all processing operations
Deploy role-based access control with principle of least privilege
Establish cryptographic audit trail integrity verification
Configure automated data retention and deletion workflows
Implement privacy-preserving age verification (boolean attribute only)
Default to IP geolocation (no GPS without consent)
organizationalMeasures: Establish data protection officer oversight of moderation workflows
Implement moderator training on GDPR and DSA compliance
Create incident response plan with breach notification procedures
Establish legal review checkpoints before feature activation
Document lawful bases and retention schedules for all processing
ongoingMonitoring: Quarterly retention audits to verify automated deletion compliance
Monthly security assessments of moderation infrastructure
Annual DPIA reviews to account for processing changes
Real-time SLA monitoring for DSA compliance (Art. 16, 17, 20)

conclusion.risks: Medium overall risk profile with critical focus on data breach prevention and moderator bias mitigation
conclusion.compliance: Designed to comply with GDPR (data minimization, storage limitation, security) and DSA (Art. 16, 17, 20, 21, 22, 23, 24, 28)
recommendations: Obtain DPO approval before production deployment
Conduct external security audit of moderation infrastructure
Deploy feature flags to ship dark until compliance validated
